intro: Kopsia mutelii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf kopsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
